column1: If 12 grams of carbon reacts with 32 grams of oxygen to form carbon dioxide, how many grams of carbon dioxide are produced? --> "44 grams of carbon dioxide are produced."
In a titration, 25.0 mL of 0.1 M hydrochloric acid neutralizes 50.0 mL of sodium hydroxide solution. What is the concentration of the sodium hydroxide solution? --> "The concentration is 0.05 M."
What is the molarity of a solution prepared by dissolving 58.44 grams of NaCl in 1 liter of water? --> "The molarity is 1 M."
A gas occupies 2 liters at a pressure of 1 atm. If the volume is changed to 4 liters while keeping temperature constant, what is the new pressure? --> "The new pressure is 0.5 atm."
If 48 grams of magnesium reacts with 64 grams of oxygen to form magnesium oxide, what is the limiting reactant? --> "Magnesium is the limiting reactant."
How many moles of water are produced when 2 moles of hydrogen gas react completely with oxygen gas? --> "2 moles of water are produced."

For a reaction at equilibrium with a Keq of 10, if the concentration of reactants is doubled and the concentration of products is halved, will the reaction shift to the left or the right? --> "The reaction will shift to the right."

If a 5.0 L flask contains 3 moles of nitrogen gas and 1 mole of hydrogen gas at 27Â°C, what is the total pressure inside the flask using R=0.0821 L.atm/mol.K? --> "The total pressure is approximately 2.48 atm."
